meanings.definition: A wardrobe or closet for storing clothes.
meanings.sent1: I keep all my clothes neatly organized in the garderobe.
meanings.sent2: She picked out a dress from the garderobe for the party.
meanings.sent3: The garderobe was so full, it almost burst open!
meanings.sent4: Her garderobe was like a treasure chest full of fashionable secrets.
meanings.sent5: The garderobe smelled of lavender and fresh laundry.

meanings.definition: A medieval toilet consisting of a seat above a chamber pot.
meanings.sent1: The castle's garderobe was a simple but necessary facility.
meanings.sent2: In medieval times, people used the garderobe for their bathroom needs.
meanings.sent3: Imagine sitting on a garderobe throne in a castle!
meanings.sent4: The garderobe was a humble yet essential part of daily life in the castle.
meanings.sent5: The garderobe was a private place for quiet contemplation.
